exclusion:
1. Power on your Dual Nano Switch, the RGB LED will be solid.
  2. Let the primary controller into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Press the Action button.
  4. If the remove is successful, the LED will blink slowly and then be colorful gradient status. If the LED still is solid, please repeat the process from step 2.

Remove Dual Nano Switch from a Z-Wave network:

  1. Power on your Dual Nano Switch, the LED will be solid.
  2. Let the primary controller into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Press the Action button.
  4. If the remove is successful, the LED will be colorful gradient status. If the LED is still solid, please repeat the process from step 2.
inclusion:
1. Power on your Dual Nano Switch, the RGB LED will be colorful gradient status.
  2. Let the primary controller into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Press the Action button.
  4. If the inclusion is successful, the LED will be solid. Otherwise, the LED will remain colorful gradient status, in which you need to repeat the process from step 2.  

Add Dual Nano Switch into a secure Z-Wave network:

  1. Power on your Dual Nano Switch, the RGB LED will be colorful gradient status.
  2. Let the secure primary controller into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Quick press the Action button 2 times.If the inclusion is successful, the LED will be solid. Otherwise, the LED will remain colorful gradient status, in which you need to repeat the process from step 2.
label: ZW139
overview: Once installed behind a switch or socket, Nano Switch offers unparalleled wireless control via Z-Wave Plus. It lets you control, automate, and monitor
usage:
Reset Dual Nano Switch to factory default:

  1. Make sure the Dual Nano Switch has been powered on.
  2. Press and hold the Action Button for 20 seconds.
  3. The green LED will be on for 2 seconds and then remain colorful gradient status, which indicates the reset is successful, otherwise please repeat from step 2.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Output status after re-power
parameters.description: Configure the output status after re-power on it

parameters.label: Group 1 notifications
parameters.description: Group 1 notifications when the state of Nano Switch's load is changed
parameters.overview: To set which notification would be sent to the associated devices (Group 1) when the state of Nano Switch's load is changed.

parameters.label: Group 3 notifications
parameters.description: Notification to sent for Group 3 when using the external switch 1
parameters.overview: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association Group 3 when using the external switch 1 to switch the loads.

parameters.label: Group 4 notifications
parameters.description: Notification to sent for Group 4 when using the external switch 2
parameters.overview: To set which notification would be sent to the associated nodes in association Group 4 when using the external switch 2 to switch the loads.

parameters.label: Configure the state of LED
parameters.description: Configure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes
parameters.overview: Configure the state of LED when it is in 3 modes (Energy mode, Momentary indicate mode, Night light mode)

options.label: Night light mode. The LED will remain ON state

parameters.label: Night light mode LED state
parameters.description: Set the ON/OFF time of the LED when it is in Night light mode
parameters.overview: 0 to 60 The minute time of OFF 256 to 316 The hour time of OFF 65536 to 65596 The minute time of ON 16777216 to 16777276 The hour time of ON

parameters.label: Set appointment 1
parameters.description: Set the ON time of output load.
parameters.overview: 65536 to 65543 The day value (Mon to Sun) 16777216 Enable the setting. 256 to 316 The hour value of ON time 16777215 Disable the setting. 0 to 60 The minute value of ON time

parameters.label: Set appointment 2
parameters.description: Set the OFF time of output load
parameters.overview: 256 to 316 The hour value of ON time 65536 to 65543 The day value (Mon to Sun) 16777215 Disable the setting. 0 to 60 The minute value of ON time 16777216 Enable the setting.

parameters.label: External switch mode for S1
parameters.description: Configure the external switch mode for S1

parameters.label: External switch mode for S2
parameters.description: Configure the external switch mode for S2

parameters.label: Control destination of external switch
parameters.description: Set the control destination for external switch

options.label: control the output loads of itself
control the output loads of itself and other nodes

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: When the load state of Nano Switch (turn on/off the load) is changed, the Hail CC and Basic Report (configured by parameter 80) can be sent to the associated nodes in this group.

associations.label: Forward Group 2
associations.overview:
Forward the Basic Set, Switch All, Scene Activation Set to associated nodes in Group 2 when the Dual Nano Switch receives the Basic Set, Switch All, Scene Activation Set commands from main controller.
(E.g. Send/forward Basic Set to control the other nodes in association Group 2)

associations.label: Send Basic Set to Group 3
associations.overview:
Send Basic Set (configured by parameter 0x51 ) to the associated nodes in Group 3 when the external switch S1 is operated.
Note: The Switch Mode of external switch S1 should be identified successfully, which means that the value of Configuration parameter 0x78 should be non-zero, then the Basic Set can be sent to the associated nodes in Group 3 via triggering the S1 switch.

associations.label: Send Basic Set to Group 4
associations.overview:
Send Basic Set (enabled by Configuration parameter 0x52) to the associated nodes in Group 4 when the external switch S2 is operated.
Note: The Switch Mode of external switch S2 should be identified successfully, which means that the value of Configuration

parameter 0x79 should be non-zero, then the Basic Set can be sent to the associated nodes in Group 3 via triggering the S2 switch.
